29#include "file.h"
30
31#ifndef lint
32#if 0
33FILE_RCSID("@(#)$File: cdf_time.c,v 1.19 2019/03/12 20:43:05 christos Exp $")
34#else
35__RCSID("$NetBSD: cdf_time.c,v 1.10 2019/05/22 17:26:05 christos Exp $");
36#endif
37#endif
38
39#include <time.h>
40#ifdef TEST
41#include <err.h>
42#endif
43#include <string.h>
44
45#include "cdf.h"
46
47#define isleap(y) ((((y) % 4) == 0) && \
48 ((((y) % 100) != 0) || (((y) % 400) == 0)))
49
50static const int mdays[] = {
51 31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31
52};
53
54/*
55 * Return the number of days between jan 01 1601 and jan 01 of year.
56 */
57static int
58cdf_getdays(int year)
59{
60 int days = 0;
61 int y;
62
63 for (y = CDF_BASE_YEAR; y < year; y++)
64 days += isleap(y) + 365;
65
66 return days;
67}
68
69/*
70 * Return the day within the month
71 */
72static int
73cdf_getday(int year, int days)
74{
75 size_t m;
76
77 for (m = 0; m < __arraycount(mdays); m++) {
78 int sub = mdays[m] + (m == 1 && isleap(year));
79 if (days < sub)
80 return days;
81 days -= sub;
82 }
83 return days;
84}
85
86/*
87 * Return the 0...11 month number.
88 */
89static int
90cdf_getmonth(int year, int days)
91{
92 size_t m;
93
94 for (m = 0; m < __arraycount(mdays); m++) {
95 days -= mdays[m];
96 if (m == 1 && isleap(year))
97 days--;
98 if (days <= 0)
99 return CAST(int, m);
100 }
101 return CAST(int, m);
102}
103
104int
105cdf_timestamp_to_timespec(struct timespec *ts, cdf_timestamp_t t)
106{
107 struct tm tm;
108#ifdef HAVE_STRUCT_TM_TM_ZONE
109 static char UTC[] = "UTC";
110#endif
111 int rdays;
112
113 /* Unit is 100's of nanoseconds */
114 ts->tv_nsec = (t % CDF_TIME_PREC) * 100;
115
116 t /= CDF_TIME_PREC;
117 tm.tm_sec = CAST(int, t % 60);
118 t /= 60;
119
120 tm.tm_min = CAST(int, t % 60);
121 t /= 60;
122
123 tm.tm_hour = CAST(int, t % 24);
124 t /= 24;
125
126 /* XXX: Approx */
127 tm.tm_year = CAST(int, CDF_BASE_YEAR + (t / 365));
128
129 rdays = cdf_getdays(tm.tm_year);
130 t -= rdays - 1;
131 tm.tm_mday = cdf_getday(tm.tm_year, CAST(int, t));
132 tm.tm_mon = cdf_getmonth(tm.tm_year, CAST(int, t));
133 tm.tm_wday = 0;
134 tm.tm_yday = 0;
135 tm.tm_isdst = 0;
136#ifdef HAVE_STRUCT_TM_TM_GMTOFF
137 tm.tm_gmtoff = 0;
138#endif
139#ifdef HAVE_STRUCT_TM_TM_ZONE
140 tm.tm_zone = UTC;
141#endif
142 tm.tm_year -= 1900;
143 ts->tv_sec = mktime(&tm);
144 if (ts->tv_sec == -1) {
145 errno = EINVAL;
146 return -1;
147 }
148 return 0;
149}
150
151int
152/*ARGSUSED*/
153cdf_timespec_to_timestamp(cdf_timestamp_t *t, const struct timespec *ts)
154{
155#ifndef __lint__
156 (void)&t;
157 (void)&ts;
158#endif
159#ifdef notyet
160 struct tm tm;
161 if (gmtime_r(&ts->ts_sec, &tm) == NULL) {
162 errno = EINVAL;
163 return -1;
164 }
165 *t = (ts->ts_nsec / 100) * CDF_TIME_PREC;
166 *t = tm.tm_sec;
167 *t += tm.tm_min * 60;
168 *t += tm.tm_hour * 60 * 60;
169 *t += tm.tm_mday * 60 * 60 * 24;
170#endif
171 return 0;
172}
173
174char *
175cdf_ctime(const time_t *sec, char *buf)
176{
177 char *ptr = ctime_r(sec, buf);
178 if (ptr != NULL)
179 return buf;
180 (void)snprintf(buf, 26, "*Bad* %#16.16" INT64_T_FORMAT "x\n",
181 CAST(long long, *sec));
182 return buf;
183}
184
185
186#ifdef TEST_TIME
187int
188main(int argc, char *argv[])
189{
190 struct timespec ts;
191 char buf[25];
192 static const cdf_timestamp_t tst = 0x01A5E403C2D59C00ULL;
193 static const char *ref = "Sat Apr 23 01:30:00 1977";
194 char *p, *q;
195
196 cdf_timestamp_to_timespec(&ts, tst);
197 p = cdf_ctime(&ts.tv_sec, buf);
198 if ((q = strchr(p, '\n')) != NULL)
199 *q = '\0';
200 if (strcmp(ref, p) != 0)
201 errx(1, "Error date %s != %s\n", ref, p);
202 return 0;
203}
204#endif
